content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 594.14 - Quality assurance

State Regulations
(a) Each
provider of service shall develop a quality assurance plan. The plan shall
include, but is not limited to: (1)

Each
licensed housing program shall have a written utilization review procedure
which includes but is not limited to, review of: (i) appropriateness for admission to and
continued stay in the licensed housing program; (ii)
appropriateness of the services provided
by the licensed housing program; and
(iii)
readiness for referral and transfer of
youth who no longer meet criteria for the licensed housing program must be
included. (2)

Utilization review must be carried out by staff who do not have primary
responsibility for the resident under review. (3)

Each licensed housing programs shall have
an internal incident reporting, investigation and management process. Licensed
housing programs shall comply with Mental Hygiene Law and Part 524 of this

Title which governs incident reporting by licensed mental health programs. The
quality assurance plan shall contain written procedures for carrying out
incident management and reporting. (4)

Each licensed housing program shall have
procedures for internal monitoring of program performance. The results of this
internal monitoring shall be used to identify problems in client care and
opportunities to improve care and shall be regularly reviewed and acted on by
the governing body. (b) The Office of Mental Health shall have responsibility for monitoring the
quality of licensed housing programs and services and will monitor licensed
housing programs against the criteria as stated in the functional program
description and in accordance with this Part. (1)

External program monitoring shall be
carried out by the Office of Mental Health and/or its authorized agents. The

Office of Mental Health will review program operations, quality assurance
activities and the individual records of residents during periodic
certification visits. (2)

External
utilization review shall be carried out as necessary by the Office of Mental

Health or other agents against the criteria contained in the licensed housing
provider's functional description. (3)

The Office of Mental Health will conduct
external review of licensed housing programs as necessary based on patterns or
trends in reported incidents or on the occurrence of an individual incident of
extreme gravity. (c) Each licensed housing program shall have an Office of Mental Health approved
consumer evaluation process, in which youth, and their parents, as well as
other relevant individuals involved with the youth shall have an opportunity to
give feedback about the program in a confidential manner. The information from
this consumer process shall be summarized annually and submitted to the Office
of Mental Health, the youth, their parents and all staff in the program. The
confidentiality of residents, families and other impacted parties shall be
protected. (d) Upon a determination
that a provider of service is in violation of this Part or upon a determination
that a provider of service has failed to otherwise comply with the terms of its
operating certificate or with the provisions of any applicable statute, standard, rule or regulation, the commissioner may revoke, suspend or limit the
provider's operating certificate or impose fines in accordance withe Mental

Hygiene Law, section 31.16 and Parts 53 and 503 of this Title. Notes
